Title: Create a Travel Approval Lightning App
Functional Specifications:
Create a Travel Approval Lightning App


In your Dev1 Sandbox, skip the Trailhead Metadata and instead install this metadata for All Users


Should have 4 Components in your Commit


Promote to DevMerge, then Back Promote to all "sibling" Devs

Title: Create a Department Object
Functional Specifications:
Before working this US - make sure all Back Promotions from DevMerge have completed successfully.


Create a Department Object


In your Dev2 Sandbox, install this metadata for All Users - make sure to answer the component names conflict as "Do not install"


Once the Metadata has installed, add the Departments Custom Tab to the end of our existing Travel App after Dashboard


Should have 7 Components in your Commit


Promote to DevMerge, then Back Promote to all "sibling" Devs

Title: Create a Travel Approval Object
Functional Specifications:
Before working this US - make sure all Back Promotions from DevMerge have completed successfully.


Create a Travel Approval Object


In your Dev3 Sandbox, install this metadata for All Users - make sure to answer the component names conflict as "Do not install."


Once the Metadata has installed:


On the Travel Approval object

> Create a Department lookup field using our Department object from US Sequence 2


Stay in Setup and go to App Manager

> add the Travel Approval Custom Tab to the end of your Travel App after Department


Should have 13 Components in your Commit.


Promote/Deploy to DevMerge and Back Promote to all "sibling" Dev Sandboxes.

Once the Metadata has installed:

> Create a Travel Approval Master-Detail field using our Travel Approval object from US Sequence 3


Should have 6 Components in your Commit.

Title: Make Department Code an External Id field
Functional Specifications:
Before working this US - make sure all Back Promotions from DevMerge have completed successfully.


NOTE: We are being very good Scrum Masters here - we are assigning the Bug User Stories for each Object to the Developer who completed the original work; this is not always reality.


In your Dev2 Sandbox, go to the Department Object and find the Department Code field.


Edit the Department Code field, and check the box for External Id


Should have only 1 Component in your Commit.


Promote/Deploy to DevMerge, but do not Back Promote to the "sibling" Dev Sandboxes just yet.

Title: Clean up the All Departments List View
Functional Specifications:
In your Dev2 Sandbox, update the "All" List View for Department to include Department Code and Last Modified By


Should have only 1 Component in your Commit.


Promote/Deploy to DevMerge, but do not Back Promote to the "sibling" Dev Sandboxes just yet.

Title: Clean up Department Object Layout
Functional Specifications:
In your Dev2 Sandbox, go to the Department Object and find the Department Layout.


Edit the Department Layout so that it looks like this screenshot in Git when Previewed As System Administrator.


Make sure to set the Sort of the Travel Approvals Related List to be by Travel Approval # Ascending


Should have only 1 Component in your Commit.


Promote/Deploy to DevMerge.


Once that forward Promotion Completes Successfully, then we can Mass Back Promote all 3 Bugs to the "sibling" Dev Sandboxes together.

Title: Add Ext Id Field to Travel Approval Object and fix Case Sensitivity for Destination State Field
Functional Specifications:
Before working this US - make sure all Back Promotions from DevMerge have completed successfully.


In your Dev3 Sandbox:


Create an External Id Field on the Travel Approval object:


Label = External Id

Field Name = External_Id

Length = 18

Required = True

Unique = True

> Radial should be Case Sensitive

External Id = True


Create a new Validation Rule on the Travel Approval object:


Rule Name = Destination_State_must_be_uppercase

Active = True

Error Condition Formula = Destination_State__c <> UPPER( Destination_State__c )

Error Message = Destination State must be entered in UPPERCASE

Error Location = Destination State


Should have 4 Components in your Commit.


Promote/Deploy to DevMerge, but hold off on Back Promoting to "siblings" for now.

Title: Clean up the All Travel Approvals List View
Functional Specifications:
In your Dev3 Sandbox, update the "All" List View for Travel Approvals to include External Id, Purpose of Trip, Status, Trip Start Date, Trip End Date, Destination State, Out-of-State, Department


Should have 1 Components in your Commit.


Promote/Deploy to DevMerge, but hold off on Back Promoting to "siblings" for now.

Title: Clean up Travel Approval Object Layout, Add Expense Items Related List and add Files Related List
Functional Specifications:
In your Dev3 Sandbox, go to the Travel Approval Object and find the Travel Approval Layout.

On the Expense Items Related List, make sure to set the Sort by Expense Item Number Ascending


Should have 1 Component in your Commit.

Once the forward Promotion completes successfully, Mass Back Promote all 3 User Stories to the "sibling" Dev Sandboxes

Title: Clean up Expense Items Object Layout
Functional Specifications:
In your Dev4 Sandbox, go to the Expense Item Object and find the Expense Item Layout.


Edit the Expense Item Layout so that it looks like this screenshot in Git when Previewed As System Administrator. Also, make the Expense Type Field required in the Page Layout ONLY.

Title: Manual Task Only - Import Test Data into DevMerge and Test what you have built
Functional Specifications:
Before working this US - make sure all Forward Promotions to DevMerge and all Back Promotions from DevMerge have completed successfully.


For this User Story, we will not be using the Trailhead module; rather, you will import the 3 Data files from our Bootcamp Examples Git Repository into DevMerge:


1. Departments (for DevMerge)

2. Travel Approvals (for DevMerge)

3. Expense Items (for DevMerge)


_______________


Then, later on, we will move the Test Data into QA using Deployment Tasks of Type = Data (SOQL Queries).

_______________


Finally, in order to move the Test Data into UAT, we will leverage Copado Data Deploy (Data Templates).
